content: ridged messy bun hat by audrey mason about keep warm while still wearing your bun or pony tail perfect for after gym or last-minute errands the top opening is ribbed and bound off using jeny s stretchy bind off to keep the opening flexible and small and the purl ridges give the hat a little pizzazz size makes a medium size hat 20 that should fit most since the purl ridges provide additional adjustability special skills circular knitting jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind-off yarn approximately 180 yds worsted weight yarn wool or other bouncy yarn needle & gauge 20 circular needle or double-sided us size 6 4 25 mm or size to obtain gauge 20 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette double sided needles us size 4 3 5 mm for ribbing other notions 1 stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends stitch abbreviations ** - repeat instructions between asterisks k knit k2tog - knit 2 stitches together p - purl p2tog - purl 2 stitches together instructions with smaller needle s cast on 102 place marker join to work in the round take care not to twist ribbing 8 rounds of k3 p3 ribbing 1 | copyright 2017 by audrey mason this pattern its photos and products made from this pattern are intended for private use only and may not be distributed or manufactured for commercial or retail purposes without the written consent of the designer amason1@maine rr com v1 1 body switch to larger needle s knit 8 row purl 3 row knit 8 row purl 3 row knit 8 row purl 2 row next row *p2tog p15* until end you should now have 96 stitches piece should measure about 5 loose and 6 25 with purl ridges flattened crown / bun opening switch to smaller needles we are going to start with p3 k3 ribbing and decrease down to p1 k1 ribbing 3 rounds of p3 k3 ribbing *p1 p2tog k3* until end *p2 k3* until end *p2tog k3* until end *p1 k3* until end *p1 k1 k2tog* until end *p1 k2* until end *p1 k2tog* until end *p1 k1* until end you should now have 32 stitches cast off using jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind-off http //www knitty com/issuefall09/featjssbo php finishing using the tapestry needle weave in ends no need to block after washing your hat dry flat to maintain the purled ridges about the designer audrey mason lives in portland maine with her husband and two cats she has been knitting since 1984 and her second knitted project ever was a knitted suit this is her first published design 2 | copyright 2017 by audrey mason this pattern its photos and products made from this pattern are intended for private use only and may not be distributed or manufactured for commercial or retail purposes without the written consent of the designer amason1@maine rr com v1 1
